title: Christs politician, and Salomons puritan Deliuered in two sermons preached before the Kings Maiestie. By Thomas Scot Bachelour of Diuinitie and one of his Maiesties chapleines. These two sermons epitomiz'de. Beware of men; of hypocrites beware. Who likes not this, no friends but enemies are. Be not too iust; be not a puritan.  Yet be as pure a Christian as you can.
author: Scott, Thomas, preacher at the Rolls Chapel.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed by Edward Griffin for Francis Constable, and are to be sold at his shop at the signe of the White Lion in Paules Church-yard,
